page.title: 04Farms and farming
page.content: There are many old farmhouses in the area. Most of the farms are tenanted farms, and used to be owned by the owners of Barleycombe Lodge in Christon. The owner has recently died and now no-one really knows what is going to happen to the farms in the village. Although the motorway has divided the Dibble's farm in half, Mr. Dibble, Senior divided the farm into two. One son farms pigs, dairy cattle and grows feed for them. This is at Yarberry Farm. The other son farms beef cattle, corn and sheep. This is at Manor Farm, Christon.} The farms are divided into two types of farming. The land on the upper parts of the hills are used for rough grazing, and some cereal crops, where the land is flat enough.
